overview:
At fifteen, Charles Randy Wooten realized that he is a very fortunate young man. His parents raised him to acknowledge everyone as equals, especially the less fortunate such as the homeless and the poor. When a tornado destroyed Wooten’s home, the incident ignited the passion within him to serve others.

Wooten juggles his work in real estate and entertainment with his musical prowess and creativity. He volunteers at the Bread and Roses CafÃ© where his influence as a musician is appreciated as he organizes benefit concerts for the establishment. When not volunteering, working, or playing music, Wooten relaxes by reading books, and watching television shows and movies.

Additional information about his volunteer work is available at http://www.stjosephctr.org/documents/AnnualReport08-09StJosephCenter.pdf
